messages: 8dca14c2a2d3d1013deabebfb1e8e148 (00:16): trying to convince my corporate to use font-face as I said before
8dca14c2a2d3d1013deabebfb1e8e148 (00:17): are there any big websites using @font-face?
8dca14c2a2d3d1013deabebfb1e8e148 (00:17): if so, please list
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (00:20): which is the bigger issue? browser support or the "fear" of putting their font on a server
4ce5fcd163ba0e30a57a168539c40004 (00:20): 8dca14c2a2d3d1013deabebfb1e8e148: I think Google has used it on some sites, perhaps related to WebM or otherwise.
4ce5fcd163ba0e30a57a168539c40004 (00:20): I forget where I saw it.
4ce5fcd163ba0e30a57a168539c40004 (00:20): If I find it, I'll share it here (If I remember).
8dca14c2a2d3d1013deabebfb1e8e148 (00:21): plz i'd appreciate that hugely
8dca14c2a2d3d1013deabebfb1e8e148 (00:21): their fear is licensing...
8dca14c2a2d3d1013deabebfb1e8e148 (00:21): and folks using it as a web font and the EULA agreements
8dca14c2a2d3d1013deabebfb1e8e148 (00:22): if I can just show them some big websites using, it'll make my case
8dca14c2a2d3d1013deabebfb1e8e148 (00:22): for WebOnly feature
8dca14c2a2d3d1013deabebfb1e8e148 (00:22): at least
8dca14c2a2d3d1013deabebfb1e8e148 (00:22): but I've looked and searched and have not seen it anywhere
8dca14c2a2d3d1013deabebfb1e8e148 (00:22): not even twitter
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (00:23): i think most of the BIG sites are going to be notably slow in adapting the new shit
8dca14c2a2d3d1013deabebfb1e8e148 (00:23): twitter has been adapting alot of new html5 features
8dca14c2a2d3d1013deabebfb1e8e148 (00:23): i was suprised no font-face though
8dca14c2a2d3d1013deabebfb1e8e148 (00:23): and google of course too
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (00:25): personally i want to tell them to suck it up and accept it
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (00:25): chances are most people won't bother
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (00:26): and those that do, will know how to do it anyway or find it elsewhere
8dca14c2a2d3d1013deabebfb1e8e148 (00:26): if it were that easy I'd do the same.
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (00:27): or they can stick to the traditional websafe fonts, or use images for their fancy text
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (00:27): i wonder if you can restrict access to the files with htaccess
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (00:27): i know you could for at least accessing the directory
8dca14c2a2d3d1013deabebfb1e8e148 (00:28): hmm that'd be a great solution
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (00:28): are you even legally allowed to name the font?
8dca14c2a2d3d1013deabebfb1e8e148 (00:28): so they can't access ANY files at all
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (00:29): be careful with that idea though, i don't know how flexible it is, it may prevent the browser from accessing too
8dca14c2a2d3d1013deabebfb1e8e148 (00:30): yea of course
8dca14c2a2d3d1013deabebfb1e8e148 (00:30): it's a thought though
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (00:31): but like i said, most corporation website are probably still in the 90s/early 00's for methods
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (00:31): just because it's insanely hard to upgrade everything
8dca14c2a2d3d1013deabebfb1e8e148 (00:32): well the idea is not to upgrade
8dca14c2a2d3d1013deabebfb1e8e148 (00:32): but moving forward
8dca14c2a2d3d1013deabebfb1e8e148 (00:32): use new technologies
8dca14c2a2d3d1013deabebfb1e8e148 (00:32): any new sites that is
8dca14c2a2d3d1013deabebfb1e8e148 (00:33): I'm tired of using images or flash embedded fonts
8dca14c2a2d3d1013deabebfb1e8e148 (00:33): cufon may be an alternative but..
8dca14c2a2d3d1013deabebfb1e8e148 (00:33): still uses javascript
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (00:34): that's another one i kind of smirk at...the people who fear the joe users who have javascript disabled
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (00:34): not saying you do
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (00:34): but you know
8dca14c2a2d3d1013deabebfb1e8e148 (00:38): oh yea that's old news for me
8dca14c2a2d3d1013deabebfb1e8e148 (00:38): we're past that :)
